H0.text: Amoeba is the unicellular organism that the scientist observed, whose vacuoles continually moved to a single site on the plasma membrane to exocytose their contents outside the cell.

H1.text: Euglena is the unicellular organism the scientist observed over time, whose vacuoles repeatedly moved to the same site on the plasma membrane to exocytose their contents outside the cell.

H2.text: Paramecium is the unicellular organism that the scientist was observing, because its vacuoles repeatedly move to the same site on the plasma membrane to exocytose their contents outside the cell.

H3.text: Volvox is the unicellular organism observed by the scientist, who noted over a period of time that its vacuoles repeatedly moved to the same spot on the plasma membrane to exocytose their contents outside the cell.

A4.text: When the fully digested vacuole reaches the anal pore, it ruptures, expelling its waste contents outside the cell.
